data.title: TmxFile2D: Fix determination of object type
data.body:
TmxObjectGroup2D::Load was using the presence of the "width" and "height" attributes for deciding whether an object was a rectangle, ellipse or something else. This approach breaks for maps saved in more recent versions of Tiled. This is because the width and height are only saved when they differ from the default (0), and because the width and height are now also used to store the size of tile objects.

So for maps saved with Tiled >= 0.12, this change:
- Fixes identification of rectangle and ellipse objects with 0 width and height (which was leading to the entire map failing to load).
- Fixes identification of tile objects.

data.title: Screen joystick KeyMap "UP DOWN LEFT RIGHT" mnemonics lead to 'RQPO' keys in KeyDown
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
In Data/UI/ScreenJoystick_Samples.xml, change "WSAD" to "UP DOWN LEFT RIGHT". Run a sample with -touch. Clicking UP results in input.keyDown[KEY_R], etc.

I took some time trying to hunt down the issue, and guess 'RQPO' could result from using the SDL scancodes (82,81,80,79) as keycodes.

This seems unrelated, but I was curious about the (char) cast from int here:
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/Input/Input.cpp#L788

data.title: Fixed Rotation bug
data.body:
1) Create Node with RigidBody2D in Editor. Default Fixed Rotation is uncheked. But it's not working. (Objects do not rotate when falliing).
2) Check Fixed Rotation and unchek it again. All works normally.
3) Save scene and reload it. Again is the problem.

data.title: CollisionXXXXX2D without RigidBody2D
data.body:
If the node does not have a RigidBody2D and create CollisionXXXXX2D component arise a warning

```
No right body component in node, can not create collision shape");
```

If then add RigidBody2D, physics still not working. Maybe we need to automatically create  RigidBody2D component? PhysicsWorld2D automatically created, if it is need.

data.title: Value Animation Bug
Engine crashes on Intel HD Graphics/OpenGL build (Win 7 x64)
data.body:
I got to compile this again with my Core i3 laptop with Intel HD on board. All went well and when I try to run snow war and Editor, I got a weird camera angle and blue background on snow war and the editor crashes after loading.

Compiled using MinGW/Codeblocks

I also got a copy of an older engine version and it works without any issues.

data.title: Texture Mipmap rendering bug (recently introduced bug)
data.body:
I have a rendering problems with my texture since i am using the lastest revision of Urho.

http://i.imgur.com/48MDNXE.jpg

As you can see it seem that only the first mipmap is rendered on my DDS textures (DXT5) i need to get very close to those trees bark to see the texture.
Maybe this bug was introduced with Sinoid changes related to DDS textures ?

data.title: Terrain Occlusion Culling not working since #822 bugfix
data.body:
It seem that the terrain culling bugfix pushed one hour ago has broken the system :)

I have set the fill mode to wireframe to see the culled objects and terrain patches and it behave strangely now. Most of the time depending on the camera position, it's not culling anything even if the objects are very clearly obstructed by the terrain.

data.title: global-editor-handlers
data.body:
If you trying to minimize or drag editor window to other desktop(monitor), again minimize or/and resize window, it probably lose handle from EditorView.as on handle ViewMouseMove() also ColorWheel lose their handlers and I guess that LayerEditor also something lose (MouseWheel event to scroll mask types) 
And that why I decide to introduce editor-global-events where all local handlers will be placed.

Please, checkout this.

data.title: [Feature request] support vertex texture fetch on GL3 / DX10+
data.body:
"Ability from the box" that allow you create textures for vertex fetch still not haven't.

Actually, i'm may to imagine how to tweak engine for supporting manual created VTF-textures on GL-Renderer. But currently i'm use DX11-Renderer and absolutely don't know how to create VTF texture in DX11. 

But also i think what this must be a standard feature for both renderers and not user's  tweaks of renderer.

data.title: Terrain Occlusion Culling Issue
data.body:
Hello, 

Here is a video so you can see this issue. When the terrain slope is quite high you can observe those culling issues.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RWc668dJf2o

Terrain is set to be occluder and occludee. The terrain patch size is 32. 

Do i need to change some parameters or is it a bug ? If yes i hope it can be fixed because it is quite important for an openworld game with terrain to have a working occlusion culling :)

data.title: SpritePacker Empty Space
data.body:
Hello, I found this sprite sheet on opengameart.org http://img.ctrlv.in/img/15/08/03/55bfc9e6950e3.png and ran it through the SpritePacker tool and got this: http://img.ctrlv.in/img/15/08/03/55bfc9c70fa77.png The frames are 32x32 which is evenly divisible into 1024 so I don't think there should be an empty space at the far right.

Edit:  I didn't run the sheet, I ran the frames extracted from the sheet, using gimp.
